body_html: Ok, I figured it out. For the running variance the unbiased estimator is used and for train-time variance the biased one. I suppose this becomes unimportant as long as there is more than one batch.
body_text: Ok, I figured it out. For the running variance the unbiased estimator is used and for train-time variance the biased one. I suppose this becomes unimportant as long as there is more than one batch.
body: Ok, I figured it out. For the running variance the unbiased estimator is used and for train-time variance the biased one. I suppose this becomes unimportant as long as there is more than one batch.
